**LMAO - Thanks, Mercedes. As an atheist it's always nice to be

messages.subject: Re: The Reverent Kelly GuhRAYam
messages.msgSnippet: Rue writes:  I ll nominate you, Rue. Rue is our voice of compassion
messages.messageBody:
Rue writes:
<<<<<<< Kelly - That was a fun post to read :0). I wanna be someone
too! ~Rue >>>>>>

I'll nominate you, Rue.

Rue is our voice of compassion calmly and succinctly helping all - in
and out of church.

(I've enjoyed reading Rue's comments on other lists too - that's how
I know she's not a hypocrite!!!!)



Sorry this is was sort of wimpy - I'm a Lutheran - we don't show
feelings - in church or elsewhere . . . . .

Mercedes
who can't believe she's spoken aloud in church

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] The Reverent Kelly GuhRAYam
messages.msgSnippet: -=-Only difficulty I had with this post, Kelli, is that I would expect to see principles or guidelines as opposed to *rules*-=- I m sorry. Did you not see
messages.messageBody:
-=-Only difficulty I had with this post, Kelli, is that I would expect to
see "principles" or "guidelines" as opposed to *rules*-=-


I'm sorry. Did you not see the "Experienced unschoolers, please ignore my
school-speak" that I put in there somewhere? I used "rules" on purpose.

Sometimes I'm only funny to me & Deb! <g>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:

SandraDodd@... writes:
The Reverent

ReverENDuh not t, which she is not.<<<<<<<<


Must've meant IRREVERENT, which she IS! <G>

~Kelly, IrreverENTuh

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] The Reverent Kelly GuhRAYam
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/3/2004 2:54:39 PM Eastern Standard Time, ikonstitcher@cox.net writes: And to think, you used to get annoyed when I d say Praise Dodd!
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/3/2004 2:54:39 PM Eastern Standard Time,
ikonstitcher@... writes:
And to think, you used to get annoyed when I'd say "Praise Dodd! Dodd led
me to the light!" in AOL chats... (Or maybe just when I'd say "Dodd *told*
me to unschool"??) <g>

Preach it, sisters!<<<<<


We can only get away with it here, on AlwaysLearning, as it's Sandra's e-list
for those who have already seen the light. She gets pissy anywhere else! <g>

~Kelly, Holtie Roller


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] The Reverent Kelly GuhRAYam
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/3/04 12:54:36 PM, ikonstitcher@cox.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/3/04 12:54:36 PM, ikonstitcher@... writes:

<< And to think, you used to get annoyed when I'd say "Praise Dodd! Dodd led
me to the light!" in AOL chats... >>

I feared the wrath of the infidels and pharisees.
Once in a while, still (twice this week) someone writes and accuses me of
thinking I am (in Jr. High Girl Speak) "ALL hot or something." So I try not to
wear the sequined glow in the dark cape too much, y'know. It disturbs the
neighbors.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] The Reverent Kelly GuhRAYam
messages.msgSnippet: ... And to think, you used to get annoyed when I d say Praise Dodd!  Dodd led me to the light! in AOL chats...  (Or maybe just when I d say Dodd *told* me
messages.messageBody:
on 2/3/04 10:21 AM, SandraDodd@... at SandraDodd@... wrote:

>
> In a message dated 2/3/04 11:14:39 AM, fuerst@... writes:
>
> << My husband last night called me the "Billy Graham of UNschooling". I am
> the
> evangelist---I scream the loudest! And I want to convert you! <BWG>. >>
>
> -=-Only difficulty I had with this post, Kelli, is that I would expect to
> see "principles" or "guidelines" as opposed to *rules*-=-
>
>
> SHE IS Brother BILLY! She has no time for you to come to principles.
> You must Repent and believe NOW! This MOMENT!
> Unschooling stands at the door of your heart and knocks.
> Receive this precious gift right this moment.
>
> Some things can't wait.
>
> (and learning how to read isn't one of them <bwg>)
>
> (If anyone doubts that I grew up Baptist, I can continue.)
>
> Sandra

And to think, you used to get annoyed when I'd say "Praise Dodd! Dodd led
me to the light!" in AOL chats... (Or maybe just when I'd say "Dodd *told*
me to unschool"??) <g>

Preach it, sisters!

Nancy


--
Children enter school as question marks and leave as periods.
-Neil Postman, professor and author (1931- )

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] The Reverent Kelly GuhRAYam
messages.msgSnippet: The Reverent ReverENDuh  not t, which she is not.
messages.messageBody:
The Reverent

ReverENDuh not t, which she is not.

messages.subject: The Reverent Kelly GuhRAYam
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/3/04 11:14:39 AM, fuerst@fuse.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/3/04 11:14:39 AM, fuerst@... writes:

<< My husband last night called me the "Billy Graham of UNschooling". I am
the
evangelist---I scream the loudest! And I want to convert you! <BWG>. >>

-=-Only difficulty I had with this post, Kelli, is that I would expect to
see "principles" or "guidelines" as opposed to *rules*-=-


SHE IS Brother BILLY! She has no time for you to come to principles.
You must Repent and believe NOW! This MOMENT!
Unschooling stands at the door of your heart and knocks.
Receive this precious gift right this moment.

Some things can't wait.

(and learning how to read isn't one of them <bwg>)

(If anyone doubts that I grew up Baptist, I can continue.)

Sandra
